snippet: Residents of Thompson, Conn., were excited when Mario Buatta bought a historic Gothic Revival home 22 years ago, but they say it is in worse shape now.
abstract: The Appraisal; Mario Buatta has decked out aristocratic homes for America’s nouveau riche, which is why Thompson, Conn, residents say they cannot fathom how a stately 13-room landmark there, which Buatta paid $400,000 for, is in worse shape than when he took it over 22 years ago; Buatta insists that he still loves it, will not part with it and does not need everyone’s 2 cents.
lead_paragraph: Residents of Thompson, Conn., were excited when Mario Buatta bought a historic Gothic Revival home 22 years ago, but they say it is in worse shape now.

headline.seo: Mario Buatta Draws Town’s Ire for Connecticut Landmark in Decline
headline.main: With Connecticut Project Stalled, Renowned Decorator Falls Out of Favor
headline.print_headline: With Project Stalled, Renowned Decorator Falls Out of Favor
